Urbana, Ill.
Dear Harry:
I have your note of August 11th and I hope that the Gunflint
meeting was a successful one.
I am sorry that the Executive Committee did not see fit to
appropriate some funds for the Palermo meeting. But
obviously I cannot agree with your view that the Fulbright
scholarships have as high a priority. After all the Fulbright
scholars are drawing down $8000/9000 a year from Government
funds whereas we are putting out funds of our own in order to
properly represent the organization.
Insofar as the choice for the Prix Italia is concerned, I wrote
to Burton and explained that after seve ral of us had listened
to his show, we felt that the "Ways of Mankind'â€™ program
A word in your Ear was so far and away superior that it would
be the ideal programto submit.
With all best wishes, believe me,1
Cordially yours.
Seymour N. Siegel
